@LeaderHoyer @OversightDems Thank you for your friendship and your leadership my friend.

Warm regards to your family. Stay safe.

This evening at 6:30pm I will be hosting a telephone town hall about #COVIDー19 with Dr. Gabriela M. Andujar Vazquez, M.D., an infectious diseases control specialist from Tufts Medical Center. You can live stream the audio of the event here: https://t.co/6SeFRTWfga

While there is more work to be done, the #CARESAct will provide our state and local governments with resources to continue their fight against this pandemic. You can find information about what the bill will provide here: https://t.co/2a80VwCtt7

Yesterday the House passed the bipartisan $2 trillion #CARESAct to help provide personal protective equipment for nurses, doctors, healthcare workers & first responders & financial relief to hard working American families during this public health crisis. https://t.co/2a80VwCtt7
Sincere thanks to our postal service workers, grocery store workers, package delivery people and all essential personnel who continues to help get us through this difficult time.

This third stimulus package expands paid family and medical leave, adds stronger protections for workers and provides $200 B for state and local governments. This is not a perfect bill - it is a compromise with our Republican colleagues - but it is a solid and impactful effort.

I will be joining my colleagues in the House tomorrow to vote on the $2 trillion Coronavirus Relief Act so we can help restock PPE stockpiles, help hospitals & health centers & aid American families, workers & small businesses that are in desperate need of financial assistance.

Our country owes a great debt to our courageous nurses, doctors and healthcare workers, and our firefighters, police and EMS who continue to put their lives on the line to help get us through this crisis.

The filing deadline has been moved to July 15th, 2020 and all Americans who owe federal income tax will have until July 15th, 2020 as well to make their payments without penalty or interest. You can find more details here: https://t.co/xgtJKAlwAT
The Treasury Department and IRS have released new guidelines to provide some relief to tax filers who owe federal income tax in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/xgtJKAlwAT

This week we introduced H.R. 6321 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, which includes my bill that will free up resources for the homeless and food pantries while providing $15 billion for Community Development Block Grants for low- and moderate-income communities.

Proud to cosponsor the Retirement Protection Act, which was introduced this week. This bill will help protect American in retirement during this crisis by suspending tax penalties on defined contribution retirement plans.

I joined my MA Congressional colleagues to urge substantial financial assistance be included in the next #COVIDー19 stimulus package to help provide emergency aid to students, schools and for technology. You can read our letter here: https://t.co/eqLSTUkdoI
There are over 100 colleges and universities across Massachusetts whose students and employees have been severely impacted by this pandemic. https://t.co/eqLSTUkdoI

The CDBG program is critical to helping mayors and local governments continue to provide vital services to our communities throughout this pandemic.  You can read our letter here: https://t.co/5vBWnx7Bwi

As Congress works to pass a third COVID-19 funding package, my MA Congressional colleagues and I urged there be funding included for HUD’s Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) program. https://t.co/5vBWnx7Bwi
The next stimulus bill has to include significant funding for our front line community health centers. https://t.co/Vop4iS2LgA

I have met and spoken with the leaders of all of the community health centers in our district. They are doing incredible work despite being underfunded and in need of supplies, staff and equipment to help to battle the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/Vop4iS2LgA

The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act provides emergency paid sick leave & paid family leave to workers across the country that are currently being forced to choose between a paycheck & their health. You can find more information about the bill here: https://t.co/Pe8KDGhYLa

(1/2) Social Security will continue to pay benefits throughout this pandemic. Please be aware that scammers are trying to use this situation to spread false information that payments are stopping, but that is not true.

Yesterday I sent a letter to the @HHSGov and @CDCGov with my colleagues on @OversightDems requesting a copy of the Administration’s plan for producing, distributing and conducting COVID-19 testing across the country. You can read our letter here: https://t.co/XvwUXlmP3Z
Thanks to @MassGovernor Baker for requesting the emergency assistance and thanks to @RepRichardNeal and my Massachusetts Congressional colleagues for your letter of support for the effort.

The Small Business Administration will be offering federal disaster relief loans of up to $2M to help provide relief to small businesses from the impact of the COVID-19 epidemic. Applicants may apply online https://t.co/DjzhVGbyYO or call SBA's Customer Service at 800-659-2955.
Tune in to @wbz on Sunday at 8:30am to watch my discussion with Jon Keller about #COVID19

Yesterday I joined @kelleratlarge (from a safe distance) to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic and how we can best confront this crisis as a nation.  As a precaution, I urge everyone to act as if they already have the virus, which encourages social distancing and safe practices. https://t.co/1bxGloUZSI
The #FamiliesFirst Act is vital to Massachusetts residents and will help provide significant funding for food services, unemployment benefits, as well as relief for workers and families on Medicaid.
Last night the #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act was signed into law. The bipartisan house led effort will provide $1.08 B to Massachusetts in Medicaid funding.

I am extremely grateful for all our first responders, police and public health officials as they deal with this health care crisis.

Stop & Shop will begin opening from 6:00am-7:30am exclusively for customers aged 60 and older this Thursday, March 19th. https://t.co/YyqNOupugh

Stop & Shop has announced they will be opening exclusively for customers aged 60 and older from 6:00am-7:30am. Most stores will be open to the general public from 7:30am-8pm. Please plan your grocery shopping accordingly and adhere to CDC guidelines to practice social distancing.

(1/2) Effective today, all local Social Security offices will be closed to the public for in-person services to help protect employees, seniors and vulnerable people seeking benefits at this time.

We had thousands of viewers, thoughtful questions and a very informative Facebook live discussion about the #coronavirus, best practices to stay safe and how to “flatten the curve”.  In case you missed it, you can watch our discussion here: https://t.co/EO3VVO7Oqn

It is expected that the Senate and the President will quickly approve it so we can provide this relief to the American people as we navigate this crisis together. #FamiliesFirst #coronavirus

Last night the House passed the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Reponse Act, which will provide free testing for COVID-19, 2 weeks of paid sick leave, up to 3 months of paid family and medical leave and over $1 B to help provide food to low-income Americans and food banks.

SNAP provides healthy food to families in need & is especially important as we work to contain & mitigate the spread of the #coronavirus outbreak, which will have a harder impact on low-income families & seniors so it’s crucial that we stop these harmful rules from taking effect. https://t.co/hzHqey3TvK

Today I joined my Massachusetts Congressional colleagues and asked Secretary Perdue to immediately halt the Trump Administration’s attempt to cut eligibility for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. https://t.co/vmNkDvvOTR

As Congress works to pass #FamiliesFirst Act to alleviate the severe economic impacts of #coronavirus please follow all @CDCgov guidelines to help prevent spreading the illness – wash your hands, avoid touching your face & maybe use an elbow bump instead of a handshake! Stay safe https://t.co/j4Q4ogr1cu

I am thankful for the work of the Governor, our public health officials, first responders and medical personnel who have been working tirelessly to prepare for this challenge.  It is important that all our elected officials work together to fight this crisis.
It is likely that more funding will be necessary as we move forward but it is a start.  I spoke to all our Community Health Center CEOs today in order to coordinate our efforts.

Pleased to see the @CDCgov awarded the state of MA an additional $11.65M in funding to help combat the #coronavirus outbreak. Congress also recently passed a #COVID19 response bill that provides an additional $8.3B with $100 million allocated to our local Community Health Centers
Looking for up-to-date information on [#COVID19/#coronavirus]? Take a look at this resource from @CDCgov: https://t.co/v5yx4eDnLn

-Free #coronavirus testing
-Paid emergency leave
-Enhanced food security

This is how we confront this public health crisis. Congress must pass the #FamiliesFirst Act now!

President Trump says ”the number of coronavirus cases is going down”. This is false. They are skyrocketing. The number of cases in Massachusetts doubled overnight. https://t.co/XO4hiLpart

The emergency aid was approved by the Senate yesterday and the President signed the bill this morning. This funding includes allocating over $3 B for research and the development of vaccines, nearly $1 B for medical supplies and health care and $2.2 B for public health funding.

This week the House passed H.R. 6074, the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, to provide $8.3 B in emergency funding for an effective and well-coordinated response to protect the health and safety of all Americans.

I spoke with our witnesses about how we can ensure there will be no resistance or dilemma when the CDC requests this type of information from airlines to protect the general public. https://t.co/xCsZ66aaST

The CDC requests this info so they can alert fellow passengers that were seated nearby to inform them they may have been exposed to the virus so they can take the necessary precautions. Right now that information is not being regularly shared by airlines. https://t.co/xCsZ66aaST

Only 10% of America’s recorded public art works are dedicated to historical female figures and this monument authorized by H.R. 473 will honor the 19th amendment and the women who fought for voting equality. #womenshistorymonth2020
Pleased to see the House passed the bipartisan H.R. 473 last week, which would authorize the first outdoor monument honoring the women’s suffrage movement in Washington, D.C.  #womenshistorymonth2020

We are now one step closer to ensuring the ERA becomes the 28th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution. #ERANow #ERAVote

When Congress first passed the #ERA in 1972, there was an arbitrary 7-year ratification deadline (which was later extended by 3 years) and by removing it this resolution will help clear up any legal ambiguity and reaffirm our support for women’s equality.

Very proud to see the House passed H.J.Res.79 to facilitate the official ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, which prohibits discrimination on the basis of sex. #ERAVote
